detailsOfAchievement: Ramakrishna Miision Tuberculosis Sanatorium, P.O. RK Sanatorium, Ranchi-835221 is one of the branch centres of the Ramakrishna Mission having its headquarters at Belur Math, Howrah-711202(W.B.). The Ramakrishna Mission was registered on the 4th May, 1909 under ACT XXI of 1860, Registration no. 1917/3for 1909-10. Revised according to West Bengal ACT XXVI of 1961. The objectives of the Association as per the extracts from the memorandum of association of the Ramakrishna Mission are: (a)To ompart and promote the study of Vedanta and its principles as propounded by Sri Ramakrishna and practically illustratedby his own life and Comparative Theology in its widest form (b)To establish, maintain, carry on and assist schools, colleges, universities, research institutions, libraries, auditoriums, orphanages, workshops, laboratories, hospitals, dispensaries, houses for the aged, infirm, the invalid and the afflicted, relief and rehabilitation works, and any other educational, medical, cultural and social welfare service activities and training institutions and charitable works and institutions of a like nature (c)To take up development and general welfare actvities for the benefit for underprivileged,backward,tribal people of the society without any discrimination. Activities: At a time when there was hardly any scope for treatment of Tuberculosis in our country, the Ramakrishna Mission Tuberculosis Sanatorium, Ranchi came into being in 1951 rurally in the Ranchi district of Jharkhand with the initiative of Dr Rajendra Prasad, the first President of Republic India. Since its inception the institution has been dedicated to the service of the tribal/adivasi people from more than 600 surrounding villages. 150-beds hospital exclusively for TB patients under the concepts of Sanatorium & method of treatment for Tuberculosis:Since its inception the institution has been serving tuberculosis patients all across the country. The method of treatment here is based on Anti-tuberculosis treatment (ATT) which includes ensuring properand weight-related drug intake to avoid MDR TB, daily monitoring of all physical & bio-chemical parameters to exclude side effects as well as ensuring their effectiveness for each patient & providing balanced nutritious diet. 50-beds hospital for general patients & OPD: OPD offers treatment for TB as well as other ailments with departments of: general medicine,pulmonology,radiology, ultra-sonography,pathology,gynecology & obstetrics,minor surgery,eye, orthopedics,pediatric,dentistry with general & cosmetic surgery, ENT, dermatology,physiotherapy,homeopathy and ayurveda. Number of patients treated on an average per year are TB-7500, Non-TB-25,000, Homeopathy-3600 & Ayurvedic-250. Mobile Medical Unit(MMU): The centre runs a Mobile Medical Unit thrice a weekthriughout the year covering 600 villages. The OPD & MMU together have been extending medical coverage, in addition to treatment of tuberculosis, to more than half a million people over the last decade. In addition, the centre regularly organises a number of free sopecial medical camps, in the remote villages throughout the year and other rural developmental works.

In collaboration with CTI, DoPR and UNICEF a certificate course on Local self Governance is going to be initiated. The purpose of the course is to create a cadre of young and trained LSG facilitators in the Jharkhand. This course is designed for functionaries from NGOs and CBOs, development workers, students interested to build their professional careers in LSG, academicians and professionals working on the issue of LSG. Sakh Foundation has successfully developed 6 Nos. Of module.

The 15 days training modules strategically developed by UNICEF, DOPR and Sakh Foundation to provide the facilitators to understand the practical aspects of LSG through training skills, relevance and importance of LSG, constitutional mandates and statutory provisions, finance patterns and devolution of power, decentralized planning and role of panchayats in combating social issues (women and child) through flagship schemes.

detailsOfAchievement: The organization is in Special Consultative Status with United Nations since 2013. It has formed 135 SHGs, constructed 186 watershed structures e.g pond, irrigation canal, implemented new sri rice growing technique in remote tribal villages, trained 125 women in trades like soft toys,tailoring,beauty parlour, enrolled 15 students with NIOS, worked on legal awreness in collaboration with DLSA,jamshedpur, organized gender sensitization prog for rural women,MYRADA module trng to SHGs The Jharkhand tribal development Program in collaboration with IFAD-JTDS and also supported by International Fund for Agriculture Development (IFAD), UNâ€™s World Food Programme, Govt. of India and Govt. of Jharkhand, has many successful achievement in restraining the fangs of poverty and restoring social justice by implementing holistic approach to address the adverse social conditions in components like water, forest, land, human beings and livestock at grassroots level. The sole objective of Jharkhand Tribal Development Programme is the formalization of Gram Sabha, empowerment of vulnerable groups, food security and enhancement of livelihood opportunity for the poorest of the poor, landless and marginalized section of the society.While working under this programme the organization has formalized 17 Gram Sabha by ensuring regular monthly meeting of the villagers, formed 70 SHGs of women with about 1109 members, Common Interest Groups of POPs to start IGA, Kisan Cub, Girls Club. Altogether 85 village level structures were constructed with ownership of the community. This include 126 Ponds, 52 irrigation canal, 10 village approach roaf, 2 drinking well etc. In the two years work about 180319 work days were created for the rural tribal men and women living in remote hilly terrains. It is a partnership which enabled the villagers to plan, implement and keep records of all expenses at village level. The program has also empowered farmers, women and weaker tribal communities to create demand at grassroots level. The concept of down to top planning was thus realized successfully. The organization is currently working on SCA to TSP program being supported by JTDS in 6 villages of east singhbhum district in jharkhand.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The project was implemented in 17 villages of Potka block under east singhbhum district since 2007. The prog has five components i.e water, forest, land, human resourses and livestock development. It thus covers health, income, environment, education, agriculture and other issues concerning five components. The objective of the Programme is to develop and implement a replicable model that ensures household food security and improves livelihood opportunities and overall quality of life of tribal

detailsOfAchievement: Empowering people on Natural Resource Management protection of forest Livelihood through locally available resources empowering farmers through scientific learning awakening people to their cultural and social values to build cohesive communities in the villages Cleanliness hygiene and rural health Integrated development of eight Panchayats educational support to children in the rural villages and slums and work on immunization and child health in hard to reach villages in Jharkhand.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The project is to support the education of poor children in the rural villages of the districts of Ranchi, Lohardaha, Khunti, Simdega and Gumla in the State of Jharkhand. The projects helps children with school fees, hostel fees, books and uniforms. Poor children are able to get education because of the program.

The project was to help some poor people in the rural villages of Palamau and Latehar districts in Jharkhand. Most of the beneficiaries are patients suffering from Tuberculosis, or widow, or very poor daily labourers. The families also contributed by labour and other possible supports

This is a small project to support the Nurses working in the Faith Based Health Centres in all the districts of the State of Jharkhand to follow a standard treatment guidelines in implementing the Primary health care to the rural folks who do not have much facilities in health assistance. Malaria control through distribution of mosquito nets as well as support to Anuj Oraon for correcting through operation a birth defect on his leg.

Natural Resource Management was carried out in the districts of Gumla, Simdega, Ranchi, Pakur, Palamu, Hazaribag and East Singhbhum. The purpose of the project was to help the rural communities in identifying available natural resources and making the optimum use of them for their livelihood while doing everything towards sustainability. It was a learning for people on organic manure, pest management, use of forest products and more.

This project was mainly for the capacity building of Nurses working in the rural areas of Jharkhand, in almost eighteen districts. The nurses were given classes on medical science especially in Primary Health Care. They were also given classes on child health, women health and adolescent health in order to make them effective in the care of children, mothers and adolescents.

This project was implemented in the districts of Dumka, Ranchi, West Signbhum, Khunti, Simdega, Hazaribag, Gumla, Godda, Palamu in the State of Jharkhand. The intervention was carried forward to bring about in the panchayats chosen for the purpose in these districts an integrated, inclusive and sustainable development and to educate the people to live together, work together without any distinction of caste and creed and to make a better life for themselves and the coming generations.

The purpose of the project is to build the capacity and competency of the farmers in the districts of Dumka, Pakur, Sahibganj, Ranchi, Lohardaga, Gumla, Khunti, Simdega, Hazaribag, Koderma, West Singhbhum, East Singhbhum, Godda and almost through Jharkhand. The farmers were given scientific training in Kisan Vikas Kendra and they in turn trained their fellow farmers in the villages and the neighbouring villages to increase their food self reliance and livelihood.

Learning for the Directors was a micro project to conduct capacity building program for the Directors of different organizations working with SIGN. The capacity building was on Leadership and organizational management. The Directors need leadership qualities to manage an organization and engage it for the betterment of the people.

Natural Resource Management was implemented in the districts of Ranchi, Gumla, Palamu, Hazaribag, West Singnbhum, Khunti, Simdega, Pakur. The purpose of the project was to awaken village communities to the Natural Resources available in the locality and the right management of the same using it for their livelihood and preserving the same for the coming generations. Emphasis was given on water harvesting, kitchen gardening, organic farming, cultivation according to SRI, SWI methods.

The Capacity Enhancement program was implemented in the districts of Ranchi, Gumla, Palamu, Hazaribag, West Singnbhum, Khunti, Simdega, Pakur. Sahibganj, Dumka and other districts of Jharkhand. The main thrust of the program was the enhancement of the leaders of the communities on health and hygiene, constitutional and customary laws, rights of responsibilities of citizens, culture and heritage. The project enlightened many people on these crucial topics
